Text.Value: That ship's full of poisonous vapours. Probably demonic. I'd stay away.
...You're both twice as tall as me but have half the bloody backbone!

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, TAMAN is being berated by Gimblebock. Whether or not he thinks it's deserved, he doesn't appreciate the scolding., ANIM: _LookDown_Ashamed
EditorData.NodeContext: bandit leader speaking to his crew - annoyed with them. He's a gnome, braver than the taller characters

Text.Value: The only thing you own is your life. Leave before I take that, too.
I think that ship's an invasion force. Run while you can!
Nothing's yours but your life - and I can take that from you just as easily.
I mean no harm - I'm just looking around.
And the crypt can wait! Mari and Barton have been trying to break in for days. Now we - Stop!
Attack.
Poisonous wha...?

EditorData.NodeContext: surprised and a little scared - he was just told that the thing he was going to loot emits poisonous fumes.

Text.Value: That ship is full of monsters. I wouldn't go near it.
Take your best shot - you'll only get one.
C'mon, you lot, no point in gettin' killed. Second worm gets the cheese, an' all...

EditorData.NodeContext: He's still a little bit shaken from our intimidation, but tries to get over it, by proposing to wait the danger out.

Text.Value: Your loud words hide fear, confusion. Looting that ship will bring you no peace.
What's wrong with his face? Freak.
What's wrong with her face? Freak.
What's wrong with their face? Freak.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unnerved and hostile upon seeing someone of a species not common to this world (a githyanki - yellow skin, black eyes, pointed ears and high, flat nose).

Text.Value: Dead freak. Get 'im!
Dead freak. Get 'er!
Dead freak. Get 'em!

EditorData.NodeContext: hostile upon seeing someone of a species not common to this world

Text.Value: Oh yeah? Well, we're... we're -

EditorData.NodeContext: The player just taunted him, and he's trying to retort, but he's very intimidated.

Text.Value: First you look, then you touch, then you take!

EditorData.NodeContext: He's not happy with the player saying they're just looking around, and he's going to attack soon.

Text.Value: I don't want to hurt you, but provoke me, and I'll keep stabbing long after you're dead.
Oh yeah? Well, I don't see any of your kin here to claim it!

EditorData.NodeContext: Replying to a player saying the ship he wants is their kin's prize. He thinks he's got the upper hand.

Text.Value: MINE.
Not yours - mine. Leave. Now.
But we don't know what that thing even is! And what about the crypt?

EditorData.NodeContext: Arguing for caution - they've never seen the likes of the ship that crashed before. It could be dangerous.

Text.Value: That is my kin's prize, not yours.
Selfish cur - there might be survivors, yet you think only of loot. Leave before I make you leave.
See? That thing could be carrying a plague for all we know!

EditorData.NodeContext: His/her fears are validated - they should clear off rather than court danger.

Text.Value: The only thing we're sharing with you is our pointy ends - get 'im!
The only thing we're sharing with you is our pointy ends - get 'er!
The only thing we're sharing with you is our pointy ends - get 'em!

EditorData.NodeContext: He's going to attack the player, who just said they were just looking around.

Text.Value: You're all hot air - think you can get us to leave that bounty to you? Not a chance!

EditorData.NodeContext: Looking down on the player (figuratively, not literally) - we tried to scare him away, but he won't be intimidated. He's going to attack soon.

Text.Value: I ain't fighting him. Not a chance.
I ain't fighting her. Not a chance.
I ain't fighting them. Not a chance.

EditorData.NodeContext: Decides that the player isn't someone to mess with; tells his/her superior in no uncertain terms that they don't have his back if a fight breaks out.

Text.Value: I'm telling you - it's a ship.

EditorData.NodeContext: the 'crypt' is inside the chapel they're standing outside. 'Thing' refers back to that. 'STOP!" is him interrupting himself because he's just seen the players approaching

Text.Value: ...We're, uh... we're leaving! C'mon, move it!

EditorData.NodeContext: He's intimidated/scared and his subordunate just told him she doesn't want to fight, so he's backing out of the fight.

Text.Value: Well, uh, in that case...

EditorData.NodeContext: We scared the gnome off from attacking us or investigating the crashed ship, though he doesn't really want to show it too much.

Text.Value: Uh, second mouse gets the cheese, no?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Underling hesitantly chimes in, correcting the gnome's mixed metaphor.
EditorData.NodeContext: Hesitantly chiming in to correct the boss's mixed metaphor: 'the second worm gets the cheese'.

Text.Value: I am not competition. I am annihilation.
Nobody's getting any damn cheese! Now move it!

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed because his underling corrected him on mixing up a methaphor. He isn't shouting too lood, because he just got intimidated and doesn't want to make too big of a scene.

Text.Value: What're you lot waiting for? Get 'im!
What're you lot waiting for? Get 'er!
What're you lot waiting for? Get 'em!

EditorData.NodeContext: Ordering his underlings to kill the player.

Text.Value: Got ourselves competition already! I dunno what the hells you are, but that's our ship!
Got ourselves competition already! That's our ship!

EditorData.NodeContext: 'competition' refers to the players. He's seen them coming

Text.Value: Just grin, baring your fangs.

Synopsis: The bandits are encountered near an abandoned chapel and are in the middle of an argument among themselves about whether or not to investigate (and loot) the crashed nautoloid (a spaceship) when the player approaches them. The player can convince them to clear off via lies or threats, or else is forced to fight them. A gnome named Gimblebock is in charge of this group, with his underlings, Quelanna and/or Taman, chiming in at points with their concerns.
